LanguageData.PrivilegedPrisoners_desc: Prisoners set to "chat and recruit" interaction will get the same meals as colonists, booster their mood and therefore making them easier to recruit. (This is ignored if they are in a room with a dispenser).
LanguageData.PrefNutrientPasteOverTasty: Prefer nutrient paste over raw tasty food
LanguageData.PrefNutrientPasteOverTasty_desc: If enabled, your colonists will prefer eating nutrient paste over raw tasty food (berries, milk).\nUseful if you want to save your raw food to make more cost efficient paste meals.
LanguageData.PetsPreferHunt_desc: When not injured, pets will always try to find a prey within their allowed area before fetching any food from your storage.
LanguageData.ControlPets_desc: If disabled, tame animals belonging to any faction will fetch their food vanilla like.
LanguageData.ControlPrisoners_desc: If disabled, colonists will feed your prisoners normaly.
LanguageData.PetsSafeHuntMaxStrenghtRatio_desc: Your pets will not hunt preys that have a highter strength ratio than this.\nUseful to avoid them to be injured. Ignored if they don't have alternative food source.\nVanilla default ratio is 0.5
LanguageData.UseCorpsesForTaming_desc: !! EXPERIMENTAL !! Colonists will use corpses when taming or training animals
LanguageData.UseHumanlikeCorpsesForTaming: Use humanlike corpses for animal job
LanguageData.UseHumanlikeCorpsesForTaming_desc: !! EXPERIMENTAL !! Colonists will use humanlike corpses when taming or training animals
LanguageData.ExtendedFoodOptimality_desc: Smarter, more efficient way to determine food priority for your pawns. May cause short, repeated fps drops.
LanguageData.PrintPrefsStart_desc: Prints all food preferences and all races diet on startup. Useful if you want to check the mod behaves well with other food mods.\nChanging this will immediately print the report.
LanguageData.ReportMode_desc: Prints all food preferences and all races diet on startup. Useful if you want to check the mod behaves well with other food mods.\nChanging this will immediately print the report.
LanguageData.CostFactor_desc: Food selection score malus for every point of nutrition wasted by the eater pawn.
LanguageData.FoodSearchMaxItemsCount_desc: Maximum number of food items searched by a pawn.\nLower values improve performances by reduces the food search radius of pawns.
LanguageData.SeparatedNutrientPaste_desc: Nutrient paste dispensers will produce an alternative nutrient paste meal item if it contains human meat.\nUseful to avoid cannibal meals stack with non cannibal meals and mix their ingredients. But makes your savegame dependent of the mod.
LanguageData.DispenseXcount_desc: Forces the dispenser to make {0} meals.
LanguageData.StandardMode_desc: Anything. Normal food, then insect meat and human meat at last.
LanguageData.CannibalCleanMode_desc: Human meat then others raw food (no insect meat).
LanguageData.AnimalMode_desc: Human meat then insect meat then others raw food.
LanguageData.ManualDispenseCostWarning: Manual dispense will cost {0} x {1} = {2} Wd.
LanguageData.Setting_PolicyForDesc: Food policy applied for pawns that fulfill at least one set of those conditions: {0}
LanguageData.PrintReportCommand_desc: Prints a report with all diets for every policy and all food classification made by the mod.\nUseful to check if the mod is working fine with other mods that add new foods.
